intro: Carludovica integrifolia, commonly known as the Mexican morning glory, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Convolvulaceae family, characterized by its twining stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows as a climbing vine, featuring heart-shaped leaves with smooth, entire margins. Its flowers are usually blue or purple, blooming in the morning and closing by midday. Carludovica integrifolia is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine for various purposes.
